intro: Galianthe angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or borders. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
